Class Graph

java.lang.Object
com.xml.editor.Graph
public class Graph extends Object
The `Graph` class represents a directed graph where vertices (users) are connected by edges (follower relationships). This class allows adding vertices and edges, checking if two vertices are connected, and getting adjacency lists for vertices.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Graph()
    Constructs an empty graph with no vertices or edges.

  • Method Summary

    Checks if two vertices are directly connected (i.e., if there is a directed edge between them).

  • Constructor Details

    • Graph

      public Graph()
      Constructs an empty graph with no vertices or edges.

  • Method Details

    • addVertex

      public void addVertex(int id)
      Adds a vertex (user) to the graph. If the vertex already exists, it will not be added again.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the user (vertex).

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge(int from, int to)
      Adds a directed edge (follower relationship) from one vertex to another.
      Parameters:
      from - The user who is following.
      to - The user being followed.

    • getAdjacencyList

      public List<Integer> getAdjacencyList(int id)
      Gets the adjacency list for a specific user (vertex). This list contains the users that the given user follows.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the user (vertex).
      Returns:
      A list of user IDs that the given user follows, or an empty list if the user has no followers.

    • getVertices

      public Set<Integer> getVertices()
      Gets all vertices (users) in the graph.
      Returns:
      A set of user IDs representing all vertices in the graph.

    • printGraph

      public String printGraph()
      Prints the graph in an adjacency list format.
      Returns:
      A string representing the graph's adjacency list.

    • areConnected

      public boolean areConnected(int from, int to)
      Checks if two vertices are directly connected (i.e., if there is a directed edge between them). This method checks if either vertex is following the other.
      Parameters:
      from - The user who may be following the other user.
      to - The user who may be followed by the other user.
      Returns:
      true if there is a directed edge between the two vertices, false otherwise.

    • isFollowing

      public boolean isFollowing(int from, int to)
      Checks if the first user is following the second user.
      Parameters:
      from - The user who may be following another user.
      to - The user who may be followed by the first user.
      Returns:
      true if the first user is following the second user, false otherwise.
